intro: Gypsophila litwinowii, commonly known as the Armenian baby's breath, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like inflorescences composed of numerous small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It is often used in floral arrangements due to its ethereal appearance and is also valued in traditional medicine. Gypsophila litwinowii is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
